Package org.greencheek.processio.service.usage

Package that holds the implementations that are responsible for calculating the usage of the current JVM process by querying the ProcessIO object.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
AccumulatedAverageKbPerSecondCalculator Given a starting time in the past and a current timestamp, and given the number representing the amount of bytes used by the process between those two times; the implementing class will work out the amount of Kb (Kilobytes) per second that equates to.
DifferenceInKBPerSecondCalculator Given two sets of data: A time The amount of bytes used by the process at that time period The two sets of data vary such that one set represents the amount of data used at that time period, previous to the amount of bytes used at the time period in the future presented by the second data set Given the sets of data the implementing class will return in kb (kilobytes), per second, the amount of io that has occurred between the two time periods User: dominictootell Date: 22/04/2012 Time: 09:34
ProcessIOUsage Returns the usage information for the given ProcessIO object, returning the amoutn of kb or mb that has been generated.
 

Class Summary
BasicProcessIOUsage This implementation uses both DifferenceInKBPerSecondCalculator and AccumulatedAverageKbPerSecondCalculator to return to the caller the amount of io that has been processed between two sample dates, and also since a certain given time (usually the start of the process) User: dominictootell Date: 22/04/2012 Time: 13:46
PrimitiveBasedAccumulatedAverageKBPerSecondCalculator Calculates the amount of io that has occurred between the two given dates.
PrimitiveBasedDifferenceInKBPerSecondCalculator Given the amount of io that has been processed on a previous date, this class calculates the amount of io that has occurred since that date, and the given date; for which X amount of accumulated io has been recorded User: dominictootell Date: 22/04/2012 Time: 09:31
 

Package org.greencheek.processio.service.usage Description

Package that holds the implementations that are responsible for calculating the usage of the current JVM process by querying the ProcessIO object.
